meanings.definition: The fur or hair beneath the outer coat of an animal.
meanings.sent1: The underfurs of the rabbit provide warmth in winter.
meanings.sent2: The underfurs of the bear help regulate its body temperature.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to use the underfurs as a disguise.
meanings.sent4: The underfurs of the fox were as soft as a cloud.
meanings.sent5: The underfurs of the otter shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The layer of fur closest to an animal's skin.
meanings.sent1: The underfurs of the cat keep it cozy during cold nights.
meanings.sent2: The underfurs of the dog help repel water and keep it dry.
meanings.sent3: The curious raccoon tried to make a tiny bed with the underfurs.
meanings.sent4: The underfurs of the seal were a shield against the icy waters.
meanings.sent5: The underfurs of the hamster were like a soft blanket.
